review_title: If you want to be treated like a trash work here
job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Closeness of staff in some departments
cons: Nurses are treated like trash here, these institution is after profits. they dont care about their nurses and they treat their nurses so unfairly. This is not a place to stay to build your future. They dont give you salaries commensurate to your status. And watch out if you use their facilities they will charge your insurance so much even if they dont do nothing to you! They charge my insurance $10,000 for a  lab work and a couple of medications, then I have to pay my copay which is just right but Im just wondering where the amount came from.And lastly they listen and believe  their unit managers so much even if the whole unit is begging for him to resign. When I was there 17 people resigned 80% are working for more than 10 years. Its a nightmare working there actually.

review_title: Patient care is second to profits
job_title: Medical Technologsit in Fort Worth, TX
pros:
Good 401K and investment plans 
Smaller hospital with a cozy atmosphere 
HCA company with other area hospitals for oppurtunities
cons:
Poor staffing causing good employees to leave 
Replacements ate travelers and poorly trained
No investment in new equipment 
Profit comes first and patient care is second 
Management is quick to blame employees where management is the problem 
Management positions were filled with sons of HCA upper management .
Hiring consists of the question "Are you breathing " 
Studer programs is only half implemented and not carried out by upper management
Health plans are too expensive

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Self scheduling is attempted every schedule, of course it needs to be balanced when short staffed. Plenty of committees available to join.
cons: Rarely see any leadership on the units (including manager and/or director on some units). Most units work short staffed all the time. Bonuses are rare and very low (as in $7/hr. when the critically short). Cancelled all travel contracts although knowing the units are short staffed, leaving us even shorter staffed.

review_title: If you like being treated like a dog this is the place for you
job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Worth, TX
pros: You could count on fellow nurses to lend a hand when you were handed a heavy patient load and you had one tech  or no tech to help with patients requiring constant care
cons: An RN with a BSN is nothing more than a glorified tech at this hospital.  Lack of equipment, lack of PCAs, poor computer system, management's  lack of consideration for their nurses  makes this hospital a very difficult place to work.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Worth, TX
pros:
It offers a starting point for new students. 
It pays the bills. 
Nurses and doctors are willing to explain and teach people eager to learn, but it's frowned upon, and you'll get reprimanded for it.
cons:
No training, provided for new employees. 
Where as some company provide up to eight weeksof trading count your blessings if you get one.
Very long shifts at times ( 18+ hrs) are expected.
As well as keeping your regular work hours as followed.
No balance for personal life. 
Can't trust supervisors with their word, promises or privacy.
No raises or promotions but deduction in pay for going full time employee.
ALOT of times No breaks, sometimes no lunches either.

job_title: RN, Bsn in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Good benefits; company listens to employee's feedback; good rewards programs; lots of training opportunities
cons: Low pay; for-profit hospital (and all that this entails); squeezes every penny's worth, plus some, out of employees - pretty much all staff are overworked; hospital is almost always under-staffed. Doctors admit that RNs at other hospitals do less work, for fewer hours, with better pay.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Good teamwork amongst staff trying their best to keep morale up!
cons: Miss management and new management-young and inexperienced. Whole hospital is constantly trying to role out new policies without first testing if policies are useful or even plausible.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Work flexibilty is great. The people are very nice and helpful. Senior management has an open door policy. They are very approachable.
cons: Communication is poor. Benefits are expensive and co-pays and deductibles are high. 2% raises do not cover the increase in insurance each year.

job_title: Pharm Tech in Mansfield, TX
pros: The job is incredibly easy. Its not that its simple, its just that everyone works so well together that it made the job easy
cons: Scheduling could be inconsistant. Sometimes I didn't get enough hours, other times I got more hours than I  could handle.
